docs.title: gitship
docs.text: Welcome to the documentation.

docs.title: Interactive Menu Mode
docs.text:
# Launch interactive branch manager
gitship branch

# Or from main menu
gitship
# Then choose option 7

Interactive Menu Shows:

============================================================
BRANCH MANAGEMENT
============================================================
Repository: /home/user/myproject
Current Branch: master
Default Branch: master

Local Branches:
● master (default)
  feature/new-ui
  bugfix/login-issue

Available Operations:
  1. Create new branch
  2. Switch branch
  3. Rename current branch
  4. Change default branch
  5. Delete branch
  6. List all branches (including remote)
  0. Exit

docs.title: List Branches
docs.text:
# List local branches
gitship branch list

# List with remote branches
gitship branch list --show-remote

docs.title: Create Branch
docs.text:
# Create and switch to new branch
gitship branch create --name feature/awesome --switch

# Create from specific commit/tag
gitship branch create --name hotfix --from v1.2.0

# Create without switching
gitship branch create --name experiment

docs.title: Switch Branch
docs.text: gitship branch switch --name develop

docs.title: Rename Branch
docs.text:
# Rename current branch (local only)
gitship branch rename --new-name feature/better-name

# Rename and update remote
gitship branch rename --new-name main --remote

# Rename specific branch
gitship branch rename --old-name master --new-name main --remote

docs.title: Change Default Branch
docs.text:
# Set new default branch (interactive guidance)
gitship branch set-default --name main

This will: 1. ✓ Verify branch exists locally 2. ✓ Push to remote (if needed) 3. ✓ Update local tracking 4. 💡 Show instructions for GitHub/GitLab settings

docs.title: Delete Branch
docs.text:
# Safe delete (must be merged)
gitship branch delete --name old-feature

# Force delete (even if unmerged)
gitship branch delete --name experiment --force

docs.title: 1. Visual Branch Status
docs.text:
• Current branch marked with ●
  • Default branch clearly labeled
  • Color-coded output

docs.title: 2. Safety Checks
docs.text:
• Can't delete current branch
  • Warns about unmerged changes
  • Confirms destructive operations

docs.title: 3. Remote Sync
docs.text:
• Optional remote updates for renames
  • Automatic cleanup of old remote branches
  • Push new default branch to remote

docs.title: 4. Helpful Guidance
docs.text:
When changing default branch, shows platform-specific instructions:

3. Update default branch on hosting platform:
   GitHub: Settings → Branches → Default branch → Switch to 'main'
   GitLab: Settings → Repository → Default Branch → Select 'main'
   Manual: git remote set-head origin main

docs.title: Master → Main Migration
docs.text:
# 1. Rename master to main
gitship branch rename --old-name master --new-name main --remote

# 2. Set as default
gitship branch set-default --name main

# 3. Update on GitHub/GitLab (follow instructions)

docs.title: Feature Branch Creation
docs.text:
# Quick feature branch from current state
gitship branch create --name feature/user-auth --switch
# ✓ Created branch 'feature/user-auth'
# ✓ Switched to branch 'feature/user-auth'

docs.title: Cleanup Old Branches
docs.text:
# Interactive deletion with smart warnings
gitship branch
# Choose option 5, select branches to delete
# Get warnings if unmerged

docs.title: Comparison: git vs gitship
docs.text:
Raw Git:

# Create and switch
git checkout -b feature/new

# Rename with remote update (multiple steps)
git branch -m old new
git push origin new
git push origin --delete old
git push origin -u new

# Change default (confusing!)
git symbolic-ref refs/remotes/origin/HEAD refs/remotes/origin/main
# ...then go to GitHub settings...

# Delete (error messages not beginner-friendly)
git branch -d feature
# error: The branch 'feature' is not fully merged.

Gitship:

# Create and switch
gitship branch create --name feature/new --switch

# Rename with remote update (single command)
gitship branch rename --new-name new --remote
# ✓ Renamed local branch 'old' → 'new'
# ✓ Pushed 'new' to remote
# ✓ Deleted 'old' from remote

# Change default (with guidance!)
gitship branch set-default --name main
# ✓ Branch pushed/updated on remote
# ✓ Updated local tracking
# 💡 Shows GitHub/GitLab instructions

# Delete (helpful feedback)
gitship branch delete --name feature
# ✗ Failed to delete branch: not fully merged
# 💡 Use force delete if you're sure (will lose unmerged changes)

docs.title: Why Gitship Branch is Better
docs.text:
1. Single command for complex operations (rename + remote sync)
  2. Clear visual feedback with colors and symbols
  3. Safety warnings that explain consequences
  4. Platform guidance for GitHub/GitLab settings
  5. Interactive mode for exploratory workflows
  6. Beginner-friendly error messages
  7. Smart defaults (like auto-detecting current branch)

docs.title: 📦 What's Been Created
docs.text: A complete, production-ready Python package with:

docs.title: Core Features
docs.text:
1. Main CLI Interface (gitship command)
  2. Interactive menu system
  3. Argparse-based commands

  4. Repository specification support

  5. checkgit - Commit inspector with configurable count

  6. fixgit - Selective file restorer
  7. reviewgit - NEW! Comprehensive diff analyzer
  8. config - Configuration management system

docs.title: 1. Setup Local Repository
docs.text:
cd ~/gitship
# Copy all files from gitship_complete/ to ~/gitship/
cp -r /path/to/gitship_complete/* .

# Run setup script
chmod +x setup_gitship.sh
./setup_gitship.sh

The setup script will: - Initialize git repository - Create initial commit - Set up directory structure - Install in development mode - Run tests - Create v0.2.0 tag

docs.title: 2. Create GitHub Repository
docs.text:
1. Go to https://github.com/new
  2. Repository name: gitship
  3. Description: "Interactive Git history management and commit inspection tools"
  4. Public repository
  5. Don't initialize with README (we have one)
  6. Create repository

docs.title: 3. Push to GitHub
docs.text:
cd ~/gitship

# Add remote
git remote add origin https://github.com/1minds3t/gitship.git

# Push everything
git push -u origin main --tags

docs.title: 4. Verify Installation
docs.text:
# Test commands
gitship --help
checkgit --help
reviewgit --help

# Test in a git repo
cd ~/omnipkg  # or any git repo
checkgit

docs.title: 🔧 reviewgit Features
docs.text:
The star of v0.2.0! This new command provides:

  1. Diff Statistics
  2. Shows summary of changes between any two references

  3. File-by-file breakdown

  4. Commit Messages

  5. All commit messages with full descriptions

  6. Chronological order

  7. Individual Commit Stats

  8. See what each commit changed

  9. Detailed file statistics

  10. Export Everything

  11. Creates structured text file with:

    • Summary statistics
    • All commit messages and descriptions
    • Individual commit stats
    • Full diff content

  12. Structured Filenames

  13. Format: <repo>_diff_<from>_to_<to>_<timestamp>.txt
  14. Example: omnipkg_diff_v0.1.0_to_HEAD_20260212_213045.txt

  15. Easy to find historical reviews

  16. Flexible References

  17. Tags: v1.0.0, v2.0.0
  18. Branches: main, development
  19. Commits: SHA hashes
  20. Special: HEAD

docs.title: 1. Release Preparation
docs.text:
# Review what's changed since last release
cd ~/omnipkg
gitship reviewgit --export

# File saved to: ~/omnipkg_git_cleanup/omnipkg_diff_v0.1.0_to_HEAD_<timestamp>.txt

docs.title: 2. Code Review
docs.text:
# See all commits in detail
gitship checkgit -n 20

# Export specific range
gitship reviewgit --from main --to feature-branch --export

docs.title: 3. Documentation
docs.text:
# Generate changelog between versions
gitship reviewgit --from v1.0.0 --to v2.0.0 --export

docs.title: 4. Debugging
docs.text:
# Find when changes were made
checkgit

# Revert specific files
fixgit <commit-sha>

docs.title: For omnipkg Development
docs.text:
# 1. Make changes and commit
cd ~/omnipkg
# ... make changes ...
git add .
git commit -m "feat: new feature"

# 2. Review before release
gitship reviewgit --export

# 3. Check the export
ls ~/omnipkg_git_cleanup/omnipkg_diff_*

# 4. Tag and release
git tag v0.2.1
git push origin main --tags

docs.title: Automated Release Notes
docs.text:
# Script to generate release notes for last 5 tags
cd ~/omnipkg
for tag in $(git tag | tail -n 5); do
    gitship reviewgit --from $tag --to HEAD --export
done

docs.title: 📊 Configuration
docs.text:
Default config at ~/.gitship/config.json:

{
  "export_path": "~/omnipkg_git_cleanup",
  "auto_push": true,
  "default_commit_count": 10
}

Modify via:

gitship config --set-export-path /your/path

Or edit directly:

nano ~/.gitship/config.json

pytest tests/ -v

docs.title: 🚨 Important Notes
docs.text:
• All operations are logged to /var/log/ or /tmp/
  • Exports are timestamped for historical tracking
  • Configuration persists across sessions
  • Safe operations with confirmations before destructive changes

docs.title: 💡 Pro Tips
docs.text:
1. Set up export path early: bash gitship config --set-export-path ~/omnipkg_git_cleanup

  2. Use aliases for common operations: bash alias gr='gitship reviewgit --export' alias gc='gitship checkgit'

  3. Keep historical exports: bash # Your exports are automatically timestamped # Create a git repo to version them! cd ~/omnipkg_git_cleanup git init git add . git commit -m "Historical diffs"

  4. Automate changelog generation: bash # Add to your release script gitship reviewgit --from $(git describe --tags --abbrev=0) --to HEAD --export
